title: Medical Practitioner visa (subclass 422)
summary: This page provides information about the now-closed Medical Practitioner visa (subclass 422). It outlines what current visa holders and their sponsors need to know, including visa conditions, work requirements, health insurance obligations, taxation rules, and how to notify authorities of changes in circumstances.

visa_details.application_availability: You cannot apply for this visa.
holder_rights: work in Australia for up to four years
bring family members to Australia, who can work and study
travel in and out of Australia any number of times while the visa is valid

must_not: stop being employed by the sponsoring employer
work in a position or occupation inconsistent with the one for which the visa was granted
if_employment_ends: find another employer willing to sponsor another appropriate visa (not a subclass 422)
apply for another type of visa
leave Australia before the visa ends

requirements: visa holders are responsible for their own health costs while in Australia
visa holders and family members must have adequate private medical and hospital insurance unless covered by a reciprocal health care agreement and enrolled with Medicare
private_health_insurance.insurance_providers: Can be Australian or international companies

taxation_requirements.more_information: Available on the Australian Taxation Office website

changes_to_report: phone number, email, address, or passport changes
notify_changes.consequences_of_not_reporting_new_passpo: Significant delays at the airport and possible denial of boarding

sponsor_information.sponsorship_duration: lasts for the duration of the visa holder’s visa
